sn47.39:4.1: “Mendicants, I will teach you the development of the four kinds of mindfulness meditation.
sn47.39:4.3: And what is the development of the four kinds of mindfulness meditation?
sn47.39:4.4: It’s when a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body, keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
sn47.39:4.5: They meditate by observing an aspect of feelings …
sn47.39:4.7: principles, keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
sn47.39:4.8: This is the development of the four kinds of mindfulness meditation.”
